title: CUDA 9.0 PyTorch on Mac gives "Found no NVIDIA driver" error
body_html:
Installation:
PyTorch 0.4.0a0, macOS 10.13 High Sierra, Mac Command Line Tools 8.2.3, Apple LLVM 6.0
CUDA 9.0.197

Installation with CUDA enabled from source succeeded.

When starting PyTorch, however, I get

>>> torch.cuda.is_available()
False
>>> torch.cuda.FloatTensor(1.0)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/tongfei/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/cuda/__init__.py", line 377, in _lazy_new
    _lazy_init()
  File "/Users/tongfei/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/cuda/__init__.py", line 139, in _lazy_init
    _check_driver()
  File "/Users/tongfei/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/cuda/__init__.py", line 81, in _check_driver
    http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx""")
AssertionError: 
Found no NVIDIA driver on your system. Please check that you
have an NVIDIA GPU and installed a driver from
http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx
>>> torch._C._cuda_isDriverSufficient()
False
>>> torch._C._cuda_getDriverVersion()
0

Installation:
PyTorch 0.4.0a0, macOS 10.13 High Sierra, Mac Command Line Tools 8.2.3, Apple LLVM 6.0
CUDA 9.0.197

Installation **with CUDA enabled from source** succeeded.

When starting PyTorch, however, I get
```

False
>>> torch.cuda.FloatTensor(1.0)

    _lazy_init()

    _check_driver()
  File "/Users/tongfei/anaconda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/cuda/__init__.py", line 81, in _check_driver
    http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx""")
AssertionError: 
Found no NVIDIA driver on your system. Please check that you
have an NVIDIA GPU and installed a driver from
http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx
>>> torch._C._cuda_isDriverSufficient()
False
>>> torch._C._cuda_getDriverVersion()
0
```
